memberdef.definition: typedef void(* omega_session_event_cbk_t) (const omega_session_t *, omega_session_event_t session_event, const omega_change_t *)
memberdef.name: omega_session_event_cbk_t

detaileddescription.para: On session change callback. This under-defined function will be called when an associated session changes.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* omega_viewport_event_cbk_t) (const omega_viewport_t *, omega_viewport_event_t viewport_event, const omega_change_t *)
memberdef.name: omega_viewport_event_cbk_t

detaileddescription.para: On viewport change callback. This under-defined function will be called when an associated viewport changes.

Create a file editing session from a file path
file_path
file path, will be opened for read, to create an editing session with, or nullptr if starting from scratch
cbk
user-defined callback function called whenever a content affecting change is made to this session
user_data_ptr
pointer to user-defined data to associate with this session
pointer to the created session, nullptr on failure

Destroy the given session and all associated objects (authors, changes, and viewports)
session_ptr
session to destroy

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, int64_t offset, int64_t capacity, omega_viewport_event_cbk_t cbk, void *user_data_ptr, int is_floating)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_create_viewport

detaileddescription.para:
Create a new viewport for the given author, returns a pointer to the new viewport
session_ptr
author wanting the new viewport
offset
offset for the new viewport
capacity
desired capacity of the new viewport
cbk
user-defined callback function called whenever the viewport gets updated
user_data_ptr
pointer to user-defined data to associate with this new viewport
is_floating
0 if the viewport is to remain fixed at the given offset, non-zero if the viewport is expected to "float" as bytes are inserted or deleted before the start of this viewport
pointer to the new viewport, nullptr on failure

Destroy a given viewport
viewport_ptr
viewport to destroy
0 of the viewport was successfully destroyed, and non-zero otherwise

Given a session, clear all active changes
session_ptr
session to clear all changes for
zero on success and non-zero otherwise

Given a session, undo the last change
session_ptr
session to undo the last change for
negative serial number of the undone change if successful, zero otherwise

Redoes the last undo (if available)
session_ptr
session to redo the last undo for
positive serial number of the redone change if successful, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const omega_session_t *session_ptr, const char *file_path, int overwrite, char *saved_file_path)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_save

detaileddescription.para:
Save the given session (the edited file) to the given file path. If the save file already exists, it can be overwritten if overwrite is non zero. If the file exists and overwrite is zero, a new file name will be used as determined by omega_util_available_filename.
session_ptr
session to save
file_path
file path to save to
overwrite
set to non-zero if overwriting an existing file is okay, and zero otherwise
saved_file_path
if overwrite is not set and the target file_path exists, a new file path will be created, and if this parameter is non-null, the saved file path will be copied here (must be able to accommodate FILENAME_MAX bytes)
0 on success, non-zero otherwise

Delete a number of bytes at the given offset
session_ptr
session to make the change in
offset
location offset to make the change
length
number of bytes to delete
positive change serial number on success, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, int64_t offset, const omega_byte_t *bytes, int64_t length)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_insert_bytes

detaileddescription.para:
Insert a number of bytes at the given offset
session_ptr
session to make the change in
offset
location offset to make the change
bytes
bytes to insert at the given offset
length
number of bytes to insert (if 0, strlen will be used to calculate the length of null-terminated bytes)
positive change serial number on success, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, int64_t offset, const char *cstr, int64_t length)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_insert

detaileddescription.para:
Insert a C string at the given offset
session_ptr
session to make the change in
offset
location offset to make the change
cstr
C string to insert at the given offset
length
length of the C string to insert (if 0, strlen will be used to calculate the length of null-terminated bytes)
positive change serial number on success, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, int64_t offset, const omega_byte_t *bytes, int64_t length)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_overwrite_bytes

detaileddescription.para:
Overwrite bytes at the given offset with the given new bytes
session_ptr
session to make the change in
offset
location offset to make the change
bytes
new bytes to overwrite the old bytes with
length
number of new bytes (if 0, strlen will be used to calculate the length of null-terminated bytes)
positive change serial number on success, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, int64_t offset, const char *cstr, int64_t length)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_overwrite

detaileddescription.para:
Overwrite bytes at the given offset with the given new C string
session_ptr
session to make the change in
offset
location offset to make the change
cstr
new C string to overwrite the old bytes with
length
length of the new C string (if 0, strlen will be used to calculate the length of null-terminated bytes)
positive change serial number on success, zero otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (omega_session_t *session_ptr, omega_util_byte_transform_t transform, void *user_data_ptr, int64_t offset, int64_t length, char const *checkpoint_directory)
memberdef.name: omega_edit_apply_transform

detaileddescription.para:
Checkpoint and apply the given mask of the given mask type to the bytes starting at the given offset up to the given length
session_ptr
session to make the change in
transform
byte transform to apply
user_data_ptr
pointer to user data that will be sent through to the given transform
offset
location offset to make the change
length
the number of bytes from the given offset to apply the mask to
checkpoint_directory
directory to store the checkpoint file
zero on success, non-zero otherwise

Creates a session checkpoint in the given directory.
session_ptr
session to checkpoint
checkpoint_directory
directory to create the checkpoint in
zero on success, non-zero otherwise

Destroys the last checkpoint created on the given session
session_ptr
session to remove the checkpoint
zero on success, non-zero otherwise
